dialogue_metadata.inferred_vibe: Serious and analytical discussion about financial markets.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Another brutal day on Wall Street, the Dow just dropped another 879 points.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Another brutal day on Wall Street, the Dow just dropped another eight hundred seventy nine points.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Dow dropped 879 points, or 3.1%, while the S&P 500 lost 3% and the Nasdaq Composite lost 2.8%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and that's on top of Monday's 950-point plunge. It's uh, it's really looking like investors are fleeing to safer assets, you know, bonds and such.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and that's on top of Monday's nine hundred fifty-point plunge. It's uh, it's really looking like investors are fleeing to safer assets, you know, bonds and such.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: After Mondays 1000-point drop, major stock market losses continued on Tuesday as fears over the spread of the coronavirus intensified and investors fled risky assets in favor of safer ones, like bonds.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly, and that flight to safety pushed the 10-year Treasury yield to a record low yesterday. That yield curve inversion on Tuesday is really spooking people.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly, and that flight to safety pushed the ten-year Treasury yield to a record low yesterday. That yield curve inversion on Tuesday is really spooking people.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 10-year U.S. Treasury yields hit a record low on Tuesday after the yield curvea measure of the difference between 3-month and 10-year bond yields that is widely used as a recession indicatorinverted on Monday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. And then you've got the CDC coming out saying a global pandemic is likely, which just adds fuel to the fire.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. And then you've got the C D C coming out saying a global pandemic is likely, which just adds fuel to the fire.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The CDC said on Tuesday that the coronavirus is expected to cause a global pandemic, and the U.S. has now begun its first test of an experimental drug to treat the disease.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, but then Larry Kudlow was on CNBC saying it's contained in the U.S. and won't be an economic disaster. It's like, whose assessment do you even trust?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, but then Larry Kudlow was on C N B C saying it's contained in the U.S. and won't be an economic disaster. It's like, whose assessment do you even trust?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: National Economic Council director Larry Kudlow had a more optimistic view, telling CNBCs Kelly Evans that the coronavirus has been contained in the United States and that the outbreak is not likely to be an economic tragedy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, Nouriel Roubini, who predicted the 2008 crisis, he wrote that this is gonna be way worse than markets are pricing in right now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, Nouriel Roubini, who predicted the two thousand eight crisis, he wrote that this is gonna be way worse than markets are pricing in right now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The epidemic is likely to be more severe than currently expected, and the disruption to the Chinese economy will have spillover effects on global supply chains including pharma inputs, of which China is a critical supplier and business confidence, all of which will likely be more severe than financial markets current complacency suggests, the economist Nouriel Roubini, best known for his analysis of the 2008 financial crisis, wrote in Financial News.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: He mentioned the disruption to global supply chains, especially from China, which is a huge supplier for pharma inputs. That's a massive deal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He mentioned the disruption to global supply chains, especially from China, which is a huge supplier for pharma inputs. That's a massive deal.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The epidemic is likely to be more severe than currently expected, and the disruption to the Chinese economy will have spillover effects on global supply chains including pharma inputs, of which China is a critical supplier and business confidence, all of which will likely be more severe than financial markets current complacency suggests, the economist Nouriel Roubini, best known for his analysis of the 2008 financial crisis, wrote in Financial News.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It really is. But you know, some experts are advising not to panic just yet. They're saying investors often buy the dip after these big drops.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really is. But you know, some experts are advising not to panic just yet. They're saying investors often buy the dip after these big drops.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Even with these major losses, experts say you shouldnt panic yet. One silver lining? Investors typically buy the dip following big drops.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: That's the silver lining, I guess? Though it's hard to feel optimistic when you see numbers like a 3% drop across the S&P and Nasdaq too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's the silver lining, I guess? Though it's hard to feel optimistic when you see numbers like a three percent drop across the S&P and Nasdaq too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Dow dropped 879 points, or 3.1%, while the S&P 500 lost 3% and the Nasdaq Composite lost 2.8%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. And with the first U.S. trial of an experimental medication just starting, it feels like we're in this weird limbo between hope and fear.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. And with the first U.S. trial of an experimental medication just starting, it feels like we're in this weird limbo between hope and fear.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The CDC said on Tuesday that the coronavirus is expected to cause a global pandemic, and the U.S. has now begun its first test of an experimental drug to treat the disease.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, the market's just reacting to every bit of news, good or bad. It's incredibly volatile right now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, the market's just reacting to every bit of news, good or bad. It's incredibly volatile right now.

artist_script:
HostA: Another brutal day on Wall Street, the Dow just dropped another 879 points.
HostB: Yeah, and that's on top of Monday's 950-point plunge. It's uh, it's really looking like investors are fleeing to safer assets, you know, bonds and such.
HostA: Exactly, and that flight to safety pushed the 10-year Treasury yield to a record low yesterday. That yield curve inversion on Tuesday is really spooking people.
HostB: For sure. And then you've got the CDC coming out saying a global pandemic is likely, which just adds fuel to the fire.
HostA: Right, but then Larry Kudlow was on CNBC saying it's contained in the U.S. and won't be an economic disaster. It's like, whose assessment do you even trust?
HostB: I mean, Nouriel Roubini, who predicted the 2008 crisis, he wrote that this is gonna be way worse than markets are pricing in right now.
HostA: He mentioned the disruption to global supply chains, especially from China, which is a huge supplier for pharma inputs. That's a massive deal.
HostB: It really is. But you know, some experts are advising not to panic just yet. They're saying investors often buy the dip after these big drops.
HostA: That's the silver lining, I guess? Though it's hard to feel optimistic when you see numbers like a 3% drop across the S&P and Nasdaq too.
HostB: Totally. And with the first U.S. trial of an experimental medication just starting, it feels like we're in this weird limbo between hope and fear.
HostA: Yeah, the market's just reacting to every bit of news, good or bad. It's incredibly volatile right now.
